docs.title: Emojis for Godot
docs.text:
Addon for easy using Emojis in Godot UI

  • is compatible with emojis Unicode 15.1
  • uses Google Noto Emojis Color font
  • uses json data generated using python

docs.title: Emoji Finder Tutorial
docs.text:
First add one of this nodes: - EmojiIcon - EmojiButton

Open Emoji Finder, go to Godot's menu Project (1) > Tools (2) > Emoji Finder (3) So you can find the emojis easily.

You can search (1) emojis and change preview size (2), and click on emoji you want to use.

When you click on emoji you want to use it alias will be copy to system clipboard.

Now select Emoji node in scene tree.

Look at node Inspector, paste emoji alias using (Ctrl + V or Right Mouse Button > Paste) as Emoj Name (1) and set it size (2).

Now emojis are in your scene:

docs.title: Using Emojis in RichTextLabel
docs.text:
Example code of using emojis in RichTextLabel (included in addon: res://addons/emojis-for-godot/examples/LabelWithEmojis.gd): 

@tool
extends RichTextLabel

@export_multiline
var text_with_emojis: String:
    set(value):
        if !is_node_ready():
            return

        text_with_emojis = value
        bbcode_enabled = true
        text = EmojisDB.parse_emojis(value)

    get: return text_with_emojis

func _ready() -> void:
    if !Engine.is_editor_hint():
        bbcode_enabled = true
        text = EmojisDB.parse_emojis(text_with_emojis)

This is the result of the above code, with text_with_emojis = "Cool Label :smiling_face_with_sunglasses: :smiling_face_with_sunglasses, 72:"
